p: Citrus sinensis, the orange tree, is an evergreen tree of questionable origins most likely in China, northeastern India, or Japan. It has been used as a chewing stick in west Africa [ 43, 80], and in Malaysia as a decoction made from the leaves for sore mouth [ 37]. In this study, the methanol extract of woody parts of the plant had an MIC of 32 Î¼g/mL, and SI of 32.
